main.docTitle: Specification of Arrangements (Government of the Federal Republic of Germany Concerning Air Services) (Double Taxation) Order

section.name: s1
section.heading: Declaration under section 49
section.content: For the purposes of section 49 of the Ordinance it is declared that the arrangements referred to in section 2 have been made with the Government of a territory outside Hong Kong with a view to affording relief from double taxation in relation to income tax and any tax of a similar character imposed by the laws of that territory, and that it is expedient that those arrangements should have effect.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Arrangements specified
section.content: The arrangements mentioned in section 1 are in Article 8A of the Agreement made between the Government of Hong Kong and the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany, in Hong Kong, on 5 May 1995 concerning Air Services (the Agreement), as amended by the Agreed Amendment to the Agreement made between the two Governments on 8 May 1997 as specified in the Schedule and having effect according to the tenor of that Agreement and the Agreed Amendment.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.heading: Article 8A of the Agreement between the Government of Hong Kong and the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany Concerning Air Services
schedule.text: Made in Hong Kong on the 5th day of May 1995, as amended by the Agreed Amendment to the Agreement made on 8 May 1997.

subsection.content: Revenues, gross receipts, income or profits derived from the operation of aircraft in international traffic by an airline of one Contracting Party, including participation in a pool service, a joint air transport operation or an international operating agency, which are subject to tax in the area of that Contracting Party shall be exempt from income tax, profits tax and all other taxes on revenues, receipts, income or profits imposed in the area of the other Contracting Party.

Capital and assets of an airline of one Contracting Party relating to the operation of aircraft in international traffic shall be exempt from all taxes on capital and assets imposed in the area of the other Contracting Party.

Gains from the alienation of aircraft operated in international traffic and movable property pertaining to the operation of such aircraft which are received by an airline of one Contracting Party shall be subject to tax only in the area of that Contracting Party.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of this Article:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: the term “revenues, gross receipts, income or profits derived from the operation of aircraft in international traffic” shall include revenues, gross receipts, income or profits from the operation of aircraft for the carriage of persons, livestock, goods, mail or merchandise including:

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the lease of aircraft on a charter basis;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: interest on funds directly connected with the operation of aircraft in international traffic;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.def: the term “airline of one Contracting Party” means an airline incorporated and having its principal place of business in the area of that Contracting Party.

subsection.content: This Article shall not have effect as long as an Agreement for the avoidance of double taxation with respect to taxes on income providing for similar exemptions shall be in force between the Contracting Parties.”.
